Report
Verified Resident
2016 - 2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 06/12/2017
The community is a quiet, clean community for the most part. Occasionally, there are problems with bugs and local wildlife (like snakes) but those resolve themselves fairly quickly. When I received the apartment, it was clean but not perfect. The units are getting older, and there are occasionally issues with the heating and cooling, water, and windows, but the management handles them quickly and professionally. The pool and weight room are nice features, but if the rates continue to increase at the $75 a year they are I may not be able to afford it much longer. Overall, I have had a good experience with this complex, much better than my friends who went to cheaper complexes near campus or "luxury college apartments."

11

Verified Manager06/17/2017

We greatly appreciate your honest review of ARIUM Pinnacle Ridge. We strive to provide a true home and community for our residents, and it sounds like you are pleased with our community overall. Thank you, and if we can make your stay here worthy of five stars please let us know.

How was this review?
Useful
Thanks for voting!
Report
Resident
2014 - 2017 Not Recommended Reviewed 06/08/2017
Important: In Nov 2016 Pinnacle did a gift card giveaway of $40 for resident reviews on Google Reviews, Fb, Yelp and Apartmentratings. I am not saying that any reviews around that time are biased. But that fact should be mentioned. Now to my honest review: I don't know where to begin. I am a recently graduated Duke student and lived here for 3 years and each year's experience has gotten progressively worse. I've stayed because of the convenience of not having to move to other communities, but my former roommate and many of the Dukies that lived here for one year did the smart thing of moving out. I even get teased for remaining here, no joke lol. Overall: I would not recommend this community as a number of Duke students live in other communities, (e.g. Alden Place) and have better experiences. Pros: -relatively cheap (but rent has been rising to make this not the case compared to other communities) - close to Duke (5-8 min drive) - has a nice clubhouse and pool - the office staff is nice - Within this past 6 months the community has made an effort to improve its reputation. They have built a "dog park" (but as a dog owner myself it's disappointing), they bring a food truck into the community every once in a while, and now have a cop patrolling the community at night (supposedly). These are all good things, and also show that the community is aware of what residents have been complaining about. Cons: 1) I have had a number of huge roaches within the 3 years and have had to have maintenance come out numerously for them. The little spray they do here and there (which appears to be very insufficient since they are in and out in about 15 seconds) doubtfully works. It got to the point that I even stopped making complaints because it was useless. Thankfully I am from NYC and can handle some roaches, but not everyone can. 2) I've had a busted light in my building stairway for MONTHS that has never been fixed. Albeit I have never put in a report for it, as I don't think that is my job since I have seen a number of maintenance people and employees walk around that area and choose to not have it fixed. 3) Not so much recently, but in my earlier years here there were a number of criminal incidents (e.g. burglaries) in the community. That is not necessarily the community's fault, but it is important to note. 4) We are charged monthly for a "valet waste service" even if you do not want it. This service was introduced mid-lease without an option to opt out. 5) Their email system for noticing you of packages is fraught with problems. Many times I am told I have a number of packages that in person a staff member says I do not. Therefore, a wasted trip to the office. 6) every other week receive notice that the office is closed because of some "team meeting" I have a number of other cons that I could mention, but as I am a fair person I will not mention them because I attribute some of those situations to my own fault. I know that the community has been managed by a new company for about the last 2 years, and I can tell the difference. Some changes for good, many for bad.
Important: In Nov 2016 Pinnacle did a gift card giveaway of $40 for resident reviews on Google Reviews, Fb, Yelp and Apartmentratings. I am not saying that any reviews around that time are biased. But that fact should be mentioned. Now to my honest review: I don't know where to begin. I am a recently graduated Duke student and lived here for 3 years and each year's experience has gotten progressively worse. I've stayed because of the convenience of not having to move to other communities, but my former roommate and many of the Dukies that lived here for one year did the smart thing of moving out. I even get teased for remaining here, no joke lol. Overall: I would not recommend this community as a number of Duke students live in other communities, (e.g. Alden Place) and have better experiences. Pros: -relatively cheap (but rent has been rising to make this not the case compared to other communities) - close to Duke (5-8 min drive) - has a nice clubhouse and pool - the office staff is nice - Within this past 6 months the community has made an effort to improve its reputation. They have built a "dog park" (but as a dog owner myself it's disappointing), they bring a food truck into the community every once in a while, and now have a cop patrolling the community at night (supposedly). These are all good things, and also show that the community is aware of what residents have been complaining about. Cons: 1) I have had a number of huge roaches within the 3 years and have had to have maintenance come out numerously for them. The little spray they do here and there (which appears to be very insufficient since they are in and out in about 15 seconds) doubtfully works. It got to the point that I even stopped making complaints because it was useless. Thankfully I am from NYC and can handle some roaches, but not everyone can. 2) I've had a busted light in my building stairway for MONTHS that has never been fixed. Albeit I have never put in a report for it, as I don't think that is my job since I have seen a number of maintenance people and employees walk around that area and choose to not have it fixed. 3) Not so much recently, but in my earlier years here there were a number of criminal incidents (e.g. burglaries) in the community. That is not necessarily the community's fault, but it is important to note. 4) We are charged monthly for a "valet waste service" even if you do not want it. This service was introduced mid-lease without an option to opt out. 5) Their email system for noticing you of packages is fraught with problems. Many times I am told I have a number of packages that in person a staff member says I do not. Therefore, a wasted trip to the office. 6) every other week receive notice that the office is closed because of some "team meeting" I have a number of other cons that I could mention, but as I am a fair person I will not mention them because I attribute some of those situations to my own fault. I know that the community has been managed by a new company for about the last 2 years, and I can tell the difference. Some changes for good, many for bad. Read less

I lived here for two years, and was very satisfied with everything. If we ever return to Durham, I would definitely consider this apartment complex as a first choice. Everyone mentioned the good points already, it is near Duke, and has a bus stop nearby. It is a safe complex with a very nice community, with many graduate students and medical residents at Duke, never loud or unsafe. There were a few petty thefts and minor break-ins that were dealt with promptly and appropriately during the time that we were there (e.g., someone stole the loose change in the cars around the complex, but did not damage the cars), and all residents are notified anytime that happens. In Durham it takes 15 minutes to get anywhere with car. Without a car, there is a shopping area nearby, with a Target, Sams, Harris Teeter, movie theater and Saladelia (a local staple for salads and food with a Mediterranean slant). The tennis court, fitness room, racquetball court, pool, and barbecue area are great to have at the complex and we used them all the time. The staff was great and always polite. Definitely would recommend.

Report
Resident
2011 - 2016 Recommended Property Reviewed 11/12/2016
I have lived in the ARIUM Pinnacle Ridge Apartments now for 5 years. I had not lived in a apartment complex for many years but have been quite pleased living here. The rent is affordable and comparable to many of the complexes in the area. I love having the pool to be able to relax at during the summer and I like the fact that the pool is not emptied during the winter. Even though it's too cold to swim in it looks nice. There are grills and tables with umbrellas to enjoy cooking out. There are many other amenities that I enjoy also: Spacious units, a deck, large closets and I even have a wood burning fireplace!! The complex is always doing some project to make it more pleasant to live here. This past year the roads have been paved, trees cut, buildings pressure cleaned, new mulch and flowers planted, pool resurfaced and I'm quite excited about the new trash valet service that has just started. All I have to do is tie up my trash and put it outside my door in a trash container provided by the service and it is picked up 5x a week! What a great idea.The staff is also a great plus. They are always willing to help in anyway they can. Even though they recieve a lot of packages for us they are very organized in the pick up process. And always have a smile on their face. Whenever I need maintenance to address something in my apartment all I have to do is go online and place a work order request. The issue has always been addressed within a day. 2013 - 2016 Not Recommended Reviewed 07/19/2016
I lived in pinnacle ridge for a few years. When I first moved in, it wasn't bad. After the new management group (Carroll Managment) took over the place went down hill. First, these are in no way, shape, or form "luxury apartments", even if you have one that has been "renovated". The buildings are super old and you can hear everything. From your neighbor next door to the person above you walking and going to the bathroom or talking on the phone. There is absolutely no insulation in the walls that during winter, your walls will pretty much be ice cold. They will tell you this is "market price" for comparable apartments, but you can drive down the road to a bunch of luxury apartments that are nicer and newer for the same price. Also, for the price the "fitness center" should at least have working equipment. Half the equipment is old or broken. The pet deposit and rent is insane. I paid half the price of the pet deposit and half on rent where I'm currently living, and my new place has a dog park and clean up/ bag station every so many yards. Pinnacle has no dog park, there are like 3 dog stations that are always overflowing and never cleaned, and no dog bags. Not to mention no one ever cleans up their dog poop, so you have to watch where your stepping. The new Managment doesn't care about the property at all. The noise level is insane, people leave their trash all over the place, and some people think they own the pool and will blare loud music. The maintenance men are super friendly and will be out within 24 hours. But usually it's just a temporary fix until it breaks more or have more issues with it. The bug issues is outrageous. No matter how many times you have pest control spray, you will still have roaches in your place. Worse office staff ever. They are useless, of no help, and unfriendly. If you have an issue the typically response is "well, corporate..." Like I said you can find cheaper and nicer apartments right down the road. The renovated apartments are definitely not worth what they are asking for. I do not recommend this place at all!

Report
Resident
2013 - 2015 Not Recommended Reviewed 06/09/2015
For the price, this is an ok place. Pretty nice fixtures and appliances. It is kind of located in an out of the way area. I would have spent a little extra to be closer to downtown if I had known more. If you are going to be a Duke student, you probably want a car. There is a close bus stop, but it goes downtown and then you have to get on another bus to get to Duke (45min-60min). Biking is an option, but the road to Duke is narrow and does not have a shoulder at some points. The neighborhood is safe, but there were a few apartment and car break-ins while I was there. The management company changed to Arium during my time there. When Arium took over, the transition was a little messy with their computer system as email notifications for packages/rent payments ceased to be sent, payment history was deleted, and previous payment methods no longer worked. Other things: -If you have neighbors above you, you will definitely hear them. Everyone I know who had upstairs neighbors said this was a problem. -Any maintenance problems are generally fixed the same day. -The office staff is nice, but mostly unhelpful. They will listen to your problem and then say, "Corporate won't allow that." -Plenty of parking. -Gym is tiny.

Resident
2013 - 2015 Not Recommended Reviewed 05/06/2015
Terrible. Don't live here. The apartment complex is trying to rebrand as luxury apartments. Do not be fooled. The apartments are poorly and cheaply constructed, there is absolutely no insulation between floors and in the walls- we have maintenance pull up the flooring the other day to address noise problems and there is literally nothing between the boards- and there is a high crime rate. I think we are notified of break ins every month or two. There is lots of mediocre housing in Durham. Choose a place where the management is less slimy than here. They were extremely nice to us when we were prospective buyers, and have been absolutely rude and atrocious ever since we signed. The property manager is one of the most epically incompetent and compassionless people I have ever had the displeasure of dealing with. Do not be fooled by the promise to re-paint, re-carpet, and refurbish each apartment upon move in. We got an apartment that reeked of cigar smoke. Also, prospective buyers beware- pinnacle ridge had offered 50$ gift cards to its residents in exchange for positive evaluations of their living experiences, so I would be very skeptical of any glowing reviews of this place.

Also, prospective buyers beware- pinnacle ridge had offered 50$ gift cards to its residents in exchange for positive evaluations of their living experiences, so I would be very skeptical of any glowing reviews of this place. Resident
2013 - 2014 Recommended Property Reviewed 07/02/2014
I moved from New York and did all of my apartment hunting online and over the phone. I was very hesitant to sign a lease for an apartment without actually seeing the place. I read some positive reviews and the staff was helpful via phone and email, so I took the risk anyway. I could not have been more pleased. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful whenever I needed assistance. The unit was gorgeous inside and out. My unit was newly renovated with appliances and countertops. I never had an issue with bugs or rodents. The grounds always looked pristine. This is just a wonderful apartment complex. If you're on the fence about this place, just go for it. You won't regret it. The only maintenance issue I ever had was a tripped main breaker during the night. The maintenance staff talked me through the process to reset the breaker over the phone (as it was 1 in the morning) and then followed up the next day to make sure everything was fine. This is the kind of service I expect where I live and Pinnacle Ridge surely lived up to those expectations. I lived here for 1 year before moving out of state, but I would have stayed much longer if I had the opportunity. This was by far the best apartment I've lived in yet.

2012 - 2014 Recommended Property Reviewed 02/28/2014
Pinnacle Ridge has been a pretty good place to live. Nicely maintained, good amenities like a pool and tennis courts, and pretty safe and quiet. Sheryll at the office is amazing, she's helped me with pretty much every problem I've had (and there really haven't been many). Other people in the office are not as friendly, Angela has been downright rude to me and a few of my neighbors at times. Be prepared for a big increase in rent after your first year. My major complaint is the terrible state of the bathrooms and kitchens in the apartments. Mine are at least several decades old, with no updates at all. My friend who is an engineer told me they stopped making the toilet model I have at least 10 years ago, which I believe because it is disgusting and rusty. About 6 tiles have fallen off my bathroom walls and instead of redoing the wall, they just slap some glue on them and stick them back on. Kitchen is the same way, and it's a shame because they really do put effort into keeping building exteriors, grounds, and common areas looking nice.

Report
Resident
2012 - 2014 Not Recommended Reviewed 01/10/2014
So I've lived in Pinnacle Ridge for almost 2 years, and it's been alright. There are definitely worse places to live in Durham, but I've never found this to be anything special. If you're looking at their pictures of the apartments on the website,just know that very few apartments currently have the updated kitchens and everything that they're advertising. My kitchen and that of everyone I know who lives here has definitely not been improved in decades. Some positive things: Grounds are nice, they have some trees and stuff. The pool is sometimes kind of gross with all sorts of leaves in it, but they have a nice deck to tan on. I've found parking to be fine. Things they're weird about: I've already mentioned my kitchen is circa 1950, and I'm pretty sure my bathroom is worse. My toilet has multiple rust spots/stains, and my friend who is an engineer told me they haven't even made that type of toilet in over a decade. Gross. Oh, and my bath faucet, plus about 8 tiles decided to fall off the wall one day, and the guy who came to fix it (and it took about 2 months for maintenance to agree to fix it, they were convinced I had just ripped it off myself (wtf??) was shocked at how old the tile was and that it hadn't been updated. I have never known anyone here with a bathroom anywhere near as nice as the photos they are advertising on their website (which aren't even that great). Also, workers are going to be coming in and out of your apartment all the time, whether you want them to or not. I think Pinnacle Ridge just likes to have a reason to get inside peoples' apartments on a regular basis. On a final note, I still live here, but I know from friends that some of them have had a very difficult time getting their safety deposit (a cool $500) back, even when they have kept their apartment pretty immaculate. So just don't have high expectations for getting that money back.

Report
Resident
2013 Recommended Property Reviewed 12/03/2013
I've broken my review down into parts so that you can read whatever pieces apply to you! Staff: Some staff are more responsive and understanding than others, but overall the staff at Pinn Ridge is good. Safety: I'm getting to know more about the safety here. In less than 1 month, I have received two emails from the community manager reporting to us that there have been break ins into cars, as well as a break in into an apartment. I urge you to go to the crime mapping section of the Durham police department website and put in Pinnacle Ridge's address. you should get a pretty clear understanding regarding crime based on the output. The gates into and out of the complex work inconsistently. I think that welcomes crime into the development when people see they can get into the community with the gate not working. When the gates don't work, it takes forever to get them fixed. In terms of lighting of parking lights and walkways, not stellar. They need more lights, too dimly lit. Grounds: Pinnacle Ridge is a very pretty complex. The trees, grass, clubhouse, pool, etc. are quite lovely, and are maintained well. Maintenance: The maintenance guys are very nice and very patient. If you have a maintenance request, the people in the office are good about putting it through and getting maintenance out to you the same day. Pretty efficient process- I appreciate this. Pests: They have an exterminator come every single Monday to the community, and you can sign up to use him. This is free of charge and included in your rent. However, the fact they have an exterminator here every Monday makes me question if they have pest issues community wide...Maybe this is standard procedure for communities in Durham. I don't know. Have I had big scary bug issues? Yes. Noise: I constantly hear the people upstairs, and it sounds like they are wrestling. I hear loud bangs and my apartment shakes. However, this could just be my neighbors. Others may not have this experience. Sometimes you just get inconsiderate neighbors regardless of where you are living. Location: Perfect if you work anywhere at Duke. Simple easy ride. Pinn Ridge is also very close to various restaurants, shopping, food stores, post office, library, etc.-- super convenient. Would I suggest you live here: I'd recommend taking a tour of the apartments and judging for yourself, and also checking the Durham Police Department website as I suggested before making a decision. When you come to visit the apartments, if you happen to run into someone outside who lives here, stop and ask them what they think. The people that live here are friendly and I think they would take the time to answer your questions.

As a note regarding contractors, specifically, pest control, it is pretty standard to have a contract with an extermination service and to offer weekly preventive pest maintenance to rotating buildings each week. We only request service return service to specific homes if notified of need upon inspection or requested by a resident. If you have an existing pest control issue that remains unresolved, please let us know. I am also pleased to hear that you are overall happy with the service that our office staff and maintenance team has provided you to date. Customer service is very important to the entire team and we take pride in being able to assist everyone in a timely and expedient manner. We try our best to make all residents feel welcome, valued and recognized when they visit us. We want to see and hear from you. It sounds like you may have some concerns that may need addressed so I invite you to contact me directly at 919-490-0531 to see what our team can do to assist to make your stay more enjoyable. Thank you! Angela, Community Manager

Report
Verified Resident
2012 - 2013 Recommended Property Reviewed 10/23/2013
I have lived here nearly two years now (approaching a record for me) and couldn't be happier. The upgraded apartments are lovely. Due to the well-designed building layout there are few common walls and I never hear my neighbors. Everything is kept clean and pest control is stellar (despite the wooded surroundings my place is blessedly bug free - never even an ant in sight). I moved in partially due to the professionalism of the leasing staff and have not been disappointed. Every maintenance request is handled promptly (even emergency weekend requests). The office staff knows most residents by name and is great to work with, making any interaction, from package pick-ups to lease questions, a pleasant & efficient experience. The community is friendly, amenities are simple but adequate (a nice pool, gym, laundry, car wash, convenient dumpsters & recycling). I don't know that the gate provides much extra security as it is often out of commission but I nonetheless feel very safe living and parking here, even when I'm out late at night. After living in lots of apartments I've learned to put up with the downsides of community living but the benefits of Pinnacle Ridge (quiet, nice apartments, no bugs, great neighbors, professional staff) make me feel like I've hit a pretty nice jackpot. I won't be moving on soon and definitely hope to get this lucky again whenever I do.

Could sometimes hear upstairs neighbor, but the noise could have been worse. My biggest problem was the ventilation: the ducts were filthy. Dust was always coating everything and I had to take allergy meds the whole time. That was the only serious issue, though. Never saw a single roach at the place (even outside) thanks to complimentary quarterly pest control. Had no problems when I moved out. Read less

Resident
2009 - 2012 Recommended Property Reviewed 04/01/2012
Pinnacle Ridge is the perfect grad student housing and I could not think of living anywhere else while in school at Durham. It's close to Duke, has a great pool for entertaining (with two fantastic grills) has tons of room to walk a dog or run, and has a great mixture of students/families that live here. I first moved into a 2 bedroom with a roommate but later moved into a 1 bedroom to live alone. Both apartments were fantastic and any time I had a problem them maintenance staff was there within a day and fixed it quickly. The complex is slowly but surely going to through appliance, countertop, and cabinet upgrades too so - while my fixtures are a little dated - I'm thinking this will quickly be a thing of the past. Likewise, over the past 3 years I've gotten to know the staff who is always eager and friendly. I'm actually going to miss interacting with them when I graduate! The only downside I can really think of is I can hear my neighbors (especially above me) a fair amount. I guess this could be remedied by living on the top floor though (I live on the bottom floor). In essence, Pinnacle is a killer price for the right locale. I'd highly recommend it to anyone looking for housing in Durham.

Report
Resident
2009 - 2011 Recommended Property Reviewed 11/22/2011
My family and I have lived here for 3 yrs. We are relocating because my husband has finished his training. I have enjoyed living here and felt safe at my residence. Pros: Angela(the manager)is a pro and a sweetheart. She knows her residents. Prior to moving here, we lived in a different complex in the area and every time we went to the office they would ask, "Welcome to Copper Mill Apts. Would you like to rent an apt?" We stayed there until our lease was up. Back to PR, The maintenance staff is polite and responsive. In general, they do a good job. They are not experts in carpentry, heating/ac, electrical repair, etc. However, they work hard and are persistent in completing a task. The grounds, in general, are well kept. They are quick to inform us of any safety issues. CONS: Safety concerns. This is Durham. There are worst areas and better areas. This is a convenient area for shopping, Duke U, etc. But, if you are going to live here, be smart, keep your windows locked, take your GPS/Ipods out of your cars, etc. This is not a big city, but it has the struggles of a larger city. Another big issue is dog poop. The management has sent out emails trying to address this and they have doggie bag receptacles throughout the grounds, but not all people clean up after their dogs. Having young children, this becomes a problem when they want to run in the grass. Another issue is the pool. People have engaged in activities at night that are not appropriate for a public pool and on the adult side, i.e, sex. I think this was an isolated event, but how disrespectful to the community. And yes, this could happen at any complex. Sometimes, the younger folks here, also party late at night and they can be quite loud near the pool area. Finally, a small concern is that people use the pool that don't live here and are not clearly with people that live here. We have been down there and have seen a large group of folks, not from the community, at the pool. They even had a dog with them and the rules are clear that dogs are not suppose to be in the pool area. So, they need to have better security for the facilities. Overall, I have enjoyed living here. The staff is great. Having young children, I appreciate being apprised of any security issues on the complex.

Resident
2007 - 2011 Recommended Property Reviewed 07/06/2011
I lived at Pinnacle Ridge with my dog for the past 4 years and recently left after buying a house. It's a great complex with awesome and responsive management. In fact, when my house closed I still have 4 months left on my lease. The team was so awesome and even helped to find me a new tenant for the property so that I wouldn't have to make double payments. They truly went above and beyond! I lived in a top floor apartment facing the woods. It was super quiet (rarely heard any of my neighbors), shady (very important during the hot NC summers!) and put my mind at ease regarding the crime in the area. Let's face it, folks, Durham is a city and there is crime everywhere but by being smart and safe I NEVER had any problems at Pinnacle Ridge. Also, they do have a courtesy officer that lives there and they are very forthcoming about any events that do occur, which is more than I can say about other complexes in the area. The mature landscaped grounds are wonderful and super pet friendly. The layout of my apartment itself was great-- huge secluded patio and a TON of natural light through the wide banks of windows. I highly recommend the complex and the area (5 min drive to Duke and backing up to a few neighborhoods--great for running/walking, and shopping close by). Come to live at Pinnacle Ridge!!

Report
Resident
2007 - 2011 Recommended Property Reviewed 07/01/2011
I lived in three different apartments in Pinnacle Ridge from 2007 to 2011 and I really liked it. Management is great - always very pleasant and really focused on customer service. Best property managers I've ever had. Maintenance is also really pleasant and responsive. The good: --Apartment layouts are fantastic, many with lovely views --The grounds are gorgeous; the architect worked WITH nature rather than tear it down. Lots of trees. Fun to walk the dog through there. --The soundproofing is pretty good. In all three apartments in which I lived, I only heard neighbors when they were being outrageously loud. The bad: --The countertops and cabinets are probably the original ones from the mid 80s. They do offer renovated apartments but for the price I really think Waterton should budget to renovate them all at this point. It's the only negative in the apartment and it really stands out. --There have been break-ins, which isn't management's fault, but it is what it is. I don't know that this complex is any different from any other in terms of break-ins. --I think maintenance is very helpful and does a good job, but it's a large complex and there are only three guys. They're stretched pretty thin - I think they need a few more guys. I also think they should contract with someone for walkway ice removal in the winter - these guys can't get to everything all at once, and the wooden walkways are always frozen. It depends how you look at it: This really isn't a negative, necessarily. The complex is mainly made up of Duke law and grad students in their mid to late 20s - they are quiet and responsible for the most part (there have been party animal exceptions). So it's not that social for older residents. I'm in my early 40s and felt a little awkward living there, but if you're a grad student it's perfect. Still, I stayed for several years, so it wasn't that bad, just not as social as it could have been. I highly recommend this complex!
I lived in three different apartments in Pinnacle Ridge from 2007 to 2011 and I really liked it. Management is great - always very pleasant and really focused on customer service. Best property managers I've ever had. Maintenance is also really pleasant and responsive. The good: --Apartment layouts are fantastic, many with lovely views --The grounds are gorgeous; the architect worked WITH nature rather than tear it down. Lots of trees. Fun to walk the dog through there. --The soundproofing is pretty good. In all three apartments in which I lived, I only heard neighbors when they were being outrageously loud. The bad: --The countertops and cabinets are probably the original ones from the mid 80s. They do offer renovated apartments but for the price I really think Waterton should budget to renovate them all at this point. It's the only negative in the apartment and it really stands out. --There have been break-ins, which isn't management's fault, but it is what it is. I don't know that this complex is any different from any other in terms of break-ins. --I think maintenance is very helpful and does a good job, but it's a large complex and there are only three guys. They're stretched pretty thin - I think they need a few more guys. I also think they should contract with someone for walkway ice removal in the winter - these guys can't get to everything all at once, and the wooden walkways are always frozen. Resident
2009 - 2011 Recommended Property Reviewed 05/11/2011
I lived at Pinnacle for two years while in school. It is a great location--close to Duke, groceries, and a really nice Super Target. Overall I would say that it is still a good deal for the money. There are newer apartments around, but they are much more expensive. Still, be careful--I ended up locked into a rate that was significantly higher than my neighbor (with the exact same floor plan, updated carpeting/appliances, AND a better view!!!) so you just need to shop around. Management is friendly and seems eager to stay competitive with pricing, but when they raised my rent, I just couldn't justify staying here instead of a newer place. THE GOOD: Management was friendly while I lived there. (Though the office is almost all new people now, so I can't speak for future experiences). I had a washer/dryer in my unit that worked well. There is also a laundry facility in the office building. I very rarely heard my neighbors, but the people below me did complain that they could hear me. I say live on the top floor and save yourself some trouble. The grounds are fine. I had some bad experiences with lights going out too often, and when branches fall it seems like the pathways are never cleared. But maintenance did respond swiftly when I informed them of things that posed serious safety concerns, such as a broken walkway. THE BAD: They are terrible about keeping up the AC units/heaters. My heater was held together with duct tape and making terrible noises, but management insisted it was "fine" until my neighbors also complained about the noise. (Then they took a full weekend to fix it, during which I had to turn off my heater in order to get some sleep because the grating noise was absolutely unbearable.) I have multiple friends living here who have been told that their AC units are broken, but Pinnacle refuses to fix the problem, instead constantly just reloading the units with coolant. As a result, they pay ridiculous electric bills (the residents, not Pinnacle Ridge)-- about 3-4x what I was paying for mine. Be careful and ask that you get a unit with an updated AC unit. Be sure that you have all the amenities they say you have--they still insisted I had updated appliances (dishwasher, stove) although I am pretty positive I did not. THE UGLY: Parking is a nightmare in some sections. It depends on where your building is--the complex has curved roads, so I have some friends who lived on the straightaway and had no problems parking. I lived at the bottom of a curve, and it was absolutely terrible finding parking after a late night at the library. Plus, the lines are embarrassing. Some spaces could easily fit two cars, while others are a sham for even my compact car. This was the hugest drawback for me. My car has many dings and dents from neighbors, and I know of at least three people who had their car hit while it was parked at Pinnacle Ridge. They just redid the complex parking lot surface, and I must say I am VERY disappointed that they re-painted the exact same, terribly spaced spots. Really missed an opportunity there. OVERALL: I would still recommend Pinnacle Ridge. I enjoyed living here. I felt safe. There were break-ins every now and then, but just follow common-sense rules (lock your doors, don't leave home with your windows open, try not to live on the ground floor) and you will be fine. Compared to nearby apartments, it can be much less expensive. It's kept clean and really is in great condition for its age--but it is pretty old. It's a trade-off, but if you can get a good deal, it is worth it.

Resident
2010 - 2011 Recommended Property Reviewed 04/06/2011
Pinnacle Ridge has pretty much everything you need. The staff have been helpful and try to stay on top of things. In fact, when I moved in the dishwasher wasn't in great shape and the carpet had a large stain. They replaced both items same day and have been somewhat responsive whenever a need arises. Do expect that if something comes up that it may not get fixed in a timely manner or even properly. I had to check in on their progress from time to time. One of the big problems I had was that my air conditioning unit made an extremely loud noise for months before it was fixed. The apartments are a little bit older, so expect a few little quirks. They do get drafty in winter/summer due to open cracks around the doors and the windows.(My front door actually had such a large gap that a small snake got in and was right inside the door when I got in after work). I used removable weather stripping to remedy this problem. Living in Durham and an apartment complex can lend itself to break-ins. The complex has had a few break-ins over the past year. If you move in, try to get a 2nd or 3rd level apartment, especially if your apartment backs up to commercial buildings. I lived in an apartment building at the far end of the complex, which backs up to residential properties and had a locked bike on my balcony stolen, but the apartment itself was not broken into. Use common sense and lock your doors, windows, etc. Overall, reasonable place to live for the price and location to Duke. It seems mostly made up of young professionals, grad students and young families.

I have lived in Pinnacle Ridge for the last 2.5 years. Very happy with my choice, nice landscape, kind and responsive management team, comfortable rooms. There were two burglaries in the last months. However, everywhere in Durham (especially close to Duke), if you leave your windows wide open, that is an open invitation for burglary - that is not the problem of the complex. I am in fact glad that the management office informed the residents of this. I know in some other apt complex, they simply won't notice anyone if things like this happen. However, if you can, find a top-floor unit. Lower-floor units can be noisy (from up) and more subject to burglary, I suppose.

2007 - 2010 Recommended Property Reviewed 04/20/2010
Pinnacle Ridge is fantastic - I highly recommend it! I've lived at the apartment for 3 years and plan to continue to do so. The management is very kind and extremely responsive - the apartment manager and assistant manager (as well as the rest of the staff) are great to interact with, and always willing to chat about any concerns or just to say hi and share a laugh. All the maintenance requests I've put in have been resolved in less than 24 hours. The community is very well maintained and well-groomed from the landscaping, roadways (swept at least once a week), and the pool area. Aside from the pool there is a lighted tennis court, racquetball court, fitness center with a decent amount of equipment, two public grills near the pool, and the clubhouse itself which can be rented for special events. I've always found my apartment quiet and haven't met a resident who said that they had any problems with any neighbors. And I feel very safe in my apartment and in the apartment community. Just as a couple of specific examples of the staff at Pinnacle Ridge - I had a maintenance request with my bathroom, and the maintenance staff saw that my front door was a looking dingy, and repainted it for me without any request. Also, a friend of mine who also lives at Pinnacle Ridge needed a closet hanging rod replaced since it had broken. The staff took the time to both fix the closet rod then rehang all of the clothes in the closet. Its nice gestures like that that really make the difference for me, and that's why I've stayed at this apartment for so long.

Resident
2006 - 2010 Recommended Property Reviewed 04/07/2010
Superb landscaping, distinct and inviting floorplans, diverse community, and stellar office and maintenance staff, make Pinnacle Ridge Durham's Best kept secret for apartment living. As a Durham native and UNC-CH grad, I have lived in my fair share of apartments in the triangle area, and I have been very happy at Pinnacle Ridge for the past 3 years. It's super convenient location to Duke, NCCU, UNC-CH, and the Research Triangle Park make commuting easy. Shielded from the roads by trees and front and rear gates, the community's grounds are always lush with landscaping and the pool with multiple sundecks and a fountain is unbelievable! Anyone who knows Durham, knows there's crime and Pinnacle Ridge saw some of that during the economic recession. However, office staff responded IMMEDIATELY by paying 2 courtesy durham police officers to live in the community, cutting back bushes, and mounting new spotlights in the parking lots. B/C of the new homebuyer tax credit, I am leaving the PR community. I thought moving out would be the most stressful time ever; however, the property manager and her staff have made this transition so smooth through her proactive marketing of my apartment that I do not have to worry about paying months of rent AND a home mortgage. I truly felt that if I ever had a problem, the office staff would be there for me. Whether you're a student, professional, couple with kids, you'll feel at home at PR. You can't beat the hidden beauty found outside and within these apartments and if you know Durham (like I do) you'll be very surprised at the price, convenience, and caring nature of the office staff and community here. Not for a minute do I regret living at Pinnacle Ridge for these three years.

2008 - 2009 Not Recommended Reviewed 04/02/2010
I lived here for about a year, and at first it seemed great- a bit pricey but I had a washer and dryer included and a large floorplan (close to 800 square feet for a 1 bedroom) with a balcony and dining room. After awhile things started to decline- maintenance wasn't always as timely as I'd like. Had a couple roaches, LOTS of spiders, and sometimes saw dead mice along paths to apartments (although I never had one inside). There were issues with insulation and doors and windows not sealed properly and this affected my electric bill. Parking is often annoying. There seem to be a lot of international students who maybe don't have a ton of driving experienced? People often parked crooked, over the line. And there is not a lot of excess parking, so sometimes that means all the spots in front of your building are taken. The gates to the complex break all the time, so either you are scared that they'll randomly close on your car and cause damage, or they are just left wide open, which begs the question, why have them at all? Especially when they have on 2 occurrences in the past several years contributed to armed car jackings when residents had to come to a stop to wait for the gate the open late at night (there is no sensor like a garage door opener, you have to roll down your window and swipe a card- leaves you pretty vulnerable). There are also lots of car break-ins, and there were a couple 1st floor apartment break-ins while I was living there. Management always just puts a notice on all the doors notifying us of these incidents, but doesn't seem to do anything to help prevent against it. Since moving out to a new place, it was really obvious the quality of the apartment was not as good as it could be for a comparable price- it's got your standard apartment fixtures, cardboard-esque cabinetry in the kitchen and bathroom with some drawers that stick and won't open, old carpet, bad/old paint on walls. My new place has warmer color, satin paint on the walls, they put in brand new carpet before I moved in, there is bright white cabinetry with brass handles in the kitchen and bath- and I pay less (for a 2 bedroom with a roommate versus the 1 bedroom).
I lived here for about a year, and at first it seemed great- a bit pricey but I had a washer and dryer included and a large floorplan (close to 800 square feet for a 1 bedroom) with a balcony and dining room. After awhile things started to decline- maintenance wasn't always as timely as I'd like. Had a couple roaches, LOTS of spiders, and sometimes saw dead mice along paths to apartments (although I never had one inside). There were issues with insulation and doors and windows not sealed properly and this affected my electric bill. Parking is often annoying. There seem to be a lot of international students who maybe don't have a ton of driving experienced? People often parked crooked, over the line. And there is not a lot of excess parking, so sometimes that means all the spots in front of your building are taken. The gates to the complex break all the time, so either you are scared that they'll randomly close on your car and cause damage, or they are just left wide open, which begs the question, why have them at all? Especially when they have on 2 occurrences in the past several years contributed to armed car jackings when residents had to come to a stop to wait for the gate the open late at night (there is no sensor like a garage door opener, you have to roll down your window and swipe a card- leaves you pretty vulnerable). There are also lots of car break-ins, and there were a couple 1st floor apartment break-ins while I was living there. Management always just puts a notice on all the doors notifying us of these incidents, but doesn't seem to do anything to help prevent against it. Since moving out to a new place, it was really obvious the quality of the apartment was not as good as it could be for a comparable price- it's got your standard apartment fixtures, cardboard-esque cabinetry in the kitchen and bathroom with some drawers that stick and won't open, old carpet, bad/old paint on walls. My new place has warmer color, satin paint on the walls, they put in brand new carpet before I moved in, there is bright white cabinetry with brass handles in the kitchen and bath- and I pay less (for a 2 bedroom with a roommate versus the 1 bedroom). Resident
2002 - 2003 Recommended Property Reviewed 10/01/2003
After our first year of graduate school, an number of friends and I all moved to Pinnacle from Summit Square and Springfield. We asked if there were any move-in specials, and were given excellent discounts, which managment carried over when we renewed our lease a few months ago. <br> <br>Pinnacle is an older complex, and is rather thinly insulated. It´s not as "pretty" as Alexan Place, for example, and there is a bit of wear to be seen. But the floor plans are very nice (much better than the beige hell-hole we lived in at Summit...) There is a wonderful amount of storage space: we have a large two-bedroom, two-bath apartment with a coat closet, a pantry, a huge laundry room, and a linen closet, as well as a large storage closet which opens directly off our large porch. <br> <br>Finally, I cannot say enough about the maintenance staff. When we moved in to the apartment late on a Saturday evening, we discovered that the refrigerator didn´t work. The maintenance man who responded to our call had technically gotten off work 30 minutes before, but he took the time to drive to the warehouse, pick up a new refrigerator, and install it. He even removed the door and installed the hinges on the other side to keep the door from opening awkwardly and blocking the kitchen. All our requests, from minor problems to bug extermination, have been dealt with within half a day of placing the request. <br> <br>In sum, Pinnacle has fewer bells and whistles than some of the newer complexes, but is a great place to live. It´s nice to come home in the evening and see your neighbors taking walks, chatting with each other, etc.

Resident
2003 Recommended Property Reviewed 09/14/2003
I also disagree with the two naysayers. I moved in just a few months ago and things have been going great. This is the nicest apartment I have ever lived in in my life (people coming from big cities will really appreciate the value, the space, the storage in each apt, etc.). Everything in my apartment is brand new except for the cabinetry in the kitchen and bathroom, which is still fine by most standards. <br> <br>I share a two-bedroom ground floor apartment, and I´ve had no problems with bugs or noise, at all. No shady people, either, in fact all of my neighbors are law, PhD, or business students at Duke, or professionals. I love the pool, tennis court, and two grills, and Pinnacle managment has no problem with people having get-togethers in the large pool/deck area. <br> <br>Pinnacle is just down the road from Alexan Place, which is brand new. Despite this age difference, Pinnacle is just a better apartment complex for me. At Pinnacle, you actually have views of trees and landscaping, instead of other apartments/the parking lot. The buildings are more spaced out with lawn and forest areas between them. Finally, with all this talk about Pinnacle´s gate....many apartment complexes (including Alexan Place) don´t even *have* a gate.

Report
Resident
2002 - 2003 Not Recommended Reviewed 08/13/2003
I moved here a year ago despite the high price ($715 for a one bedroom...more on that later) because the place really had a community-like feel. I felt rushed to pay deposit on a second-floor unit since the management made it sound like the apartments were in high demand. <br><br>I totally regret not living on the top floor. <br><br>I´ve heard most apartments have a problem with noise. However, I don´t think any apartment could be as poorly built/insulated as this. Not only could I hear my upstairs neighbor´s footsteps but whenever he walked, the glasses in my kitchen rattled. Even more embarassing, I could hear bathroom sounds (not just toilet flush). My apartment, which is the smallest 1 bedroom floor plan, has such oddly shaped living room that you can´t fit much furniture there. Also, the kitchen for some reason is not open at all, but has this low-hanging wall that blocks light and the ability to see into the living room. Anyway, I noticed that despite what the management made me believe, there were actually a couple of vacant apartments in my building, one of which was a top floor unit. I asked to transfer and was given a whole spiel of penalty fees, contract breaches, etc. Basically they hit me with so many monetary penalties that I decided to bear with it and switch once my lease expired. <br><br>Unfortunately, things got worse. At some point a bunch of solicitations and advertisements started appearing jammed into my front door. Strangely, even Pinnacle Ridge management used this as a way to contact us about community events or even for something as important as rent! Forget about Pinnacle´s hoity claim about being a "gated community." The gate merely serves to force exiting cars to leave one-at-a-time. Anyone could walk in on foot. At night when the gates were shut, cars would just follow each other in. I don´t know if security was an issue but during my one year here, there have been three notices regarding strangers posing as utility workers in order to gain entrance into apartments, as well as "peepers." <br><br>Management changed about three times during my stay as well, which to me is a bad sign. The new manager and her team are absolutely horrible. Great at talking sweet on the phone but horrible in person. In May I asked to be put on the wait-list for apartments opening in Aug. Sure! they said. However, in July when I asked what my status was, they said my name WASN´T on the list! I spoke with the manager, who apologized but then told me there were about 40 people already on the list. I came back three days in a row to see if I could even break my lease early and move into a new apartment, and EACH time, the manager didn´t remember my name. During one visit one of the desk girls rudely introduced me with a nasally, "She´s here AGAIN." Once again, rather than encouraging me to stay, the manager listed all the penalties and fees I´d have to cough up if I wanted to change apartments. Well, without motivation of course I found a new place to live. <br><br>Pinnacle Ridge has recently lowered prices dramatically in order to fill their many vacant apartments. However, this has changed the types of people who live here. Before I saw many students and young families with children. Now I´ve noticed shadier people here. There´s also been a wrecked, junky car parked outside my building for the past couple of months, as well as a car with no wheels and a car with a flat all just sitting around that no one seems to care about. Management is so ditzy that when my friend moved in, they messed up spelling her name on the lease three times. <br><br>I´m trying to think of good things to say about Pinnacle Ridge. It is close to Duke University and is convenient to a bunch of supermarkets and restaurants. The landscaping is pretty. However, you could get all that, plus a decent sized apartment for the price of a Pinnacle apt. Dont´ be fooled by their super sales. Besides, after a year you´ll be back to paying the ridiculously high prices. The place is going downhill and the surrounding areas are slowly turning into ghetto.

Leasing

Welcome home to ARIUM Pinnacle Ridge with the convenience of location and the lifestyle of luxury. Our gated community offers 1 and 2 bedroom apartment homes with large floor plans and impeccably designed interiors. Our apartment homes boast desirable features including built-in wine racks and oversized walk-in closets. In select homes, enjoy brand new upgrades complete with stainless steel appliances and wood-style flooring. Our amenities are unbeatable. Take a swim in our resort style pool with sundeck and complimentary Wi-Fi or head to our 24-hour fitness center with cardio studio or our lighted tennis court. Your four-legged family member is welcome as we accept large dogs! We are within minutes of Duke University and hospital, Fuqua School of Business and Blue Cross/Blue Shield. You will be close to great shopping with Target and Harris Teeter right around the corner and all of the best restaurants Durham, North Carolina has to offer. Come visit us today!

Management Company: Carroll Management Group LLC

Office Hours Open Now!

  • Sunday: Closed
  • Monday - Friday: 09:00 AM - 06:00 PM
  • Saturday: 10:00 AM - 05:00 PM
